Product Description: ['Bonded by their oath to the same flag, two confederate soldiers, “Devil” Anse Hatfield (Kevin Costner) and Randall McCoy (Bill Paxton), return home seeking peace after tireless months of battle. Their expectations are quickly shattered when a murder based on misunderstandings and an illicit love affair trigger warfare between former comrades and their clans. This historic feud teeters on the brink of an all out civil war as friends and neighbors join opposing sides in a rivalry that would ultimately shape American History.']

reference_summary:
Do You Believe?
Mira Sorvino  (Actor),     Sean Astin  (Actor),     Jonathan M. Gunn  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Drama
["A dozen different souls–all moving in different directions, all longing for something more. As their lives unexpectedly intersect, they each are about to discover there is power in the Cross of Christ…even if they don't yet believe it. When a local pastor is shaken to the core by the visible faith of an old street-corner preacher, he is reminded that true belief always requires action. His response ignites a faith-fueled journey that powerfully impacts everyone it touches in ways that only God could orchestrate. More than a movie, it's a question we all must answer in our lifetimes: Do You Believe?Bonus Content:", 'Interviews', 'Interviews', 'Trailers', 'Trailers']

Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man [Blu-ray]
Mickey Rourke  (Actor),     Don Johnson  (Actor),     Simon Wincer  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
["Mickey Rourke (The Wrestler, Sin City) and Don Johnson (A Boy and His Dog, TV's Miami Vice) star in this four-lane genre collision of biker movie, heist thriller, buddy flick and sci-fi pic that will take you to the hard-line of action and adventure! Co-starring Tom Sizemore (Natural Born Killers), Chelsea Field (The Last Boy Scout), Tia Carrere (True Lies) and Vanessa Williams (Shaft), this relentlessly explosive action pic just may prove that 'it's better to be dead and cool than alive and uncool.' When their favorite bar is threatened with closure, outlaw biker Harley (Rourke) and modern-day cowboy Marlboro (Johnson) hatch a scheme to save the day - by robbing the corrupt bank behind the bar's shutdown! When the robbery yields not money but a shipment of drugs, Harley and Marlboro find themselves on the run from the bank's sinister president (Sizemore) and a posse of seemingly unstoppable hit men. Now wanted dead or alive, the hard-riding heroes must fight for their very lives and learn that when the going gets tough, the tough take the law into their own hands."]

profile:
The user showcases a strong preference for faith-based films, appreciating narratives that delve into themes of belief, personal transformation, and the impact of faith on individuals. Although their recent engagement with one film received a lower satisfaction rating of 3.0, their overall inclination towards enriching storytelling remains intact. They particularly value complex narratives delivered through ensemble casts that represent diverse character experiences, enhancing their appreciation for emotionally and philosophically engaging dramas.

Recent purchases reflect the user's growing openness to a wider range of genres, indicated by a recent action film rated 5.0, and now an acclaimed historical drama that explores deep emotional and interpersonal conflicts. This flexibility suggests a desire to experience high-quality cinematic narratives, even if they diverge from their core interest in moral or faith-driven content.

The user continues to prioritize Blu-ray formats, ensuring a consistent high-quality viewing experience. Their enjoyment of diverse films underscores an ongoing journey towards spiritual reflection and the pursuit of meaningful narratives. Overall, the user embodies a well-rounded appreciation for cinema, blending quality with deeper thematic exploration while maintaining a discerning approach to film selection and actively expanding their cinematic palate.
